Welcome to Contacts FastAPI’s documentation!¶

Contacts FastAPI main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something is wrong with our connection to the database.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index(request: Request)¶

The index function is the main page of our application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template using Jinja2. The template is located in the templates directory and named index.html.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

A templateresponse object that contains the rendered template

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It can be used to initialize resources, such as database connections.

Returns:

A list of functions to be executed at startup

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The user_agent_ban_middleware function is a middleware function that checks the user-agent header of every request. If it matches any of the patterns in user_agent_ban_list, then it returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the user-agent from the request header

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

A jsonresponse object, which is a subclass of response

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the request body and convert it to a contact object

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in a database session

  • user – User: Get the user from the request

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only deleting their own contacts

Returns:

The contact object if it was deleted,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact_by_id function is used to retrieve a contact from the database. It takes in two parameters: - contact_id: The id of the contact you want to retrieve. This should be an integer. - db: A database session object that can be used for querying and updating data in the database. This should be an AsyncSession object, which is a subclass of sqlalchemy’s Session class with some additional functionality added on top of it (see AsyncSession module).

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to access this contact

Returns:

A single contact from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_all(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts_all function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session, which is used to execute sql statements

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_bd(period: int, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_bd function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the next week.

Parameters:

  • period – int: Define the number of days in which we want to get contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset records

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are in the specified period

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_criteria(criteria: dict, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_by_criteria function is used to retrieve contacts from the database based on a set of criteria. The function takes in three arguments: - criteria: A dictionary containing key-value pairs that are used to filter the results. For example, if you wanted all contacts with a first name of &quot;John&quot;, you would pass in {&quot;first_name&quot;: &quot;John&quot;} as your criteria. If no value is passed for this argument, then it defaults to an empty dictionary (i.e., {}). This means that no filtering will be done and all contacts will be returned by default (unless limited by

Parameters:

  • criteria – dict: Filter the contacts by any number of fields

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the criteria

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify which contact to update

  • body – ContactModel: Pass in the new contact information

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user that is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email address and a database connection as arguments. It then queries the database for the user with that email address, sets their confirmed field to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to confirm

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The newly created user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user object associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A single user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user whose avatar url is to be updated

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user to update

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh token for a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database. If not, then an error message is returned saying &quot;Verification failed&quot;. If there is a user with that email, then we check if they have already confirmed their account or not. If they have already confirmed their account, then we return an error message saying &quot;Account has been verified already&quot;. Otherwise (if they haven’t yet

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email has been verified

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the email and password of the user as input, and returns an access token if authentication was successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The access_token and refresh_token in the response

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send a verification email to the user.

The function takes in an email address and sends a verification link to that address. If the user has already been verified, then it returns an error message saying so.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email address from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user that they should check their email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is the same as the one we created in schemas

Doc-author:

Trelent

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the contact information from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

A contactmodel object

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the auth_service

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), first_name: str = Query(None), last_name: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned by the api

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_all(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_all function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts

  • ge – Set the minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to this function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_bd(period: int = Query(7), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_bd function returns a list of contacts with birthday for period.
The function accepts the following parameters:

  • period (int): number of days to search for contacts with birthday, default 7 days.

  • limit (int): maximum number of results to return, default 10. Maximum 1000 results can be returned at once.

  • offset (int): pagination offset, defaults to 0.

Parameters:

  • period – int: Filter the contacts by period

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthday for period

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a ContactResponse object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Specify the type of data that is expected in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by the

get_current_user endpoint. It takes in an optional file parameter, which is used to upload a new avatar image for the user. If no file parameter is provided, then it simply returns the current user object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is being uploaded

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The current user, based on the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI service Auth¶

Bases: object

cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

An encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what email address it belongs to.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s id, username, email address, and password hash. Expires_delta is an optional argument that specifies how long the refresh token will be valid for.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

It takes in a refresh_token and returns an email if the token is valid. If it’s not, then it raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected routes. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent in the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address of the user who owns that token. The function first tries to decode the token using jwt.decode(). If it succeeds, it extracts the email address from the payload and returns it. If decoding fails, we raise an HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocessable Entity) and detail message VERIFICATION_TOKEN_INVALID.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of it. The hashing algorithm is defined in the config file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function is used to verify a plain-text password against a hashed password. The function returns True if the passwords match, and False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method work for a specific instance of the class

  • plain_password – Verify the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password from the database to the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

True if the plain_password is correct,

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts FastAPI service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.
The function takes in three parameters:

  1. email - the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account.

  2. username - the username of the new account being created. This is included in the body of

    message sent to users so that they know who has requested this verification code be sent to them (i.e., it helps prevent phishing). It also allows us to personalize our messages, which can help increase open rates and click-throughs

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be verified

  • host – str: Generate the link for the user to click on

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent
